verses.text: Now these \add are\add* the nations which the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* left , to prove Israel by them, \add even\add* as many \add of Israel\add* as had not known all the wars of Canaan ;
Only that the generations of the children of Israel might know , to teach them war , at the least such as before knew nothing thereof;
\add Namely\add*, five lords of the Philistines , and all the Canaanites , and the Sidonians , and the Hivites that dwelt in mount Lebanon , from mount Baal-hermon unto the entering in of Hamath.
And they were to prove Israel by them, to know whether they would hearken unto the commandments of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, which he commanded their fathers by the hand of Moses. \p
¶ And the children of Israel dwelt among the Canaanites , Hittites , and Amorites , and Perizzites , and Hivites , and Jebusites :
And they took their daughters to be their wives , and gave their daughters to their sons , and served their gods.

And the children of Israel did evil in the sight of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and forgat the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* their God , and served Baalim and the groves. \p

¶ Therefore the anger of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* was hot against Israel , and he sold them into the hand of Chushan-rishathaim king of Mesopotamia : and the children of Israel served Chushan-rishathaim eight years.\f + \fr 3.8 \ft Mesopotamia: Heb. Aram-naharaim\f*

And when the children of Israel cried unto the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* raised up a deliverer to the children of Israel , who delivered them, \add even\add* Othniel the son of Kenaz , Caleb’s younger brother.  +  r 3.9  t deliverer: Heb. saviour *

And the Spirit of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* came upon him, and he judged Israel , and went out to war : and the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* delivered Chushan-rishathaim king of Mesopotamia into his hand ; and his hand prevailed against Chushan-rishathaim.  +  r 3.10  t came: Heb. was *  +  r 3.10  t Mesopotamia: Heb. Aram *
And the land had rest forty years. And Othniel the son of Kenaz died. \p

¶ And the children of Israel did evil again in the sight of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*: and the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* strengthened Eglon the king of Moab against Israel , because they had done evil in the sight of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*.
And he gathered unto him the children of Ammon and Amalek , and went and smote Israel , and possessed the city of palm trees.
So the children of Israel served Eglon the king of Moab eighteen years.

But when the children of Israel cried unto the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* raised them up a deliverer , Ehud the son of Gera , a Benjamite , a man lefthanded : and by him the children of Israel sent a present unto Eglon the king of Moab.  +  r 3.15  t a Benjamite: or, the son of Jemini *  +  r 3.15  t lefthanded: Heb. shut of his right hand *
But Ehud made him a dagger which had two edges , of a cubit length ; and he did gird it under his raiment upon his right thigh.
And he brought the present unto Eglon king of Moab : and Eglon \add was\add* a very fat man.
And when he had made an end to offer the present , he sent away the people that bare the present.

But he himself turned again from the quarries that \add were\add* by Gilgal , and said , I have a secret errand unto thee, O king : who said , Keep silence. And all that stood by him went out from him.\f + \fr 3.19 \ft quarries: or, graven images\f*

And Ehud came unto him; and he was sitting in a summer parlour , which he had for himself alone. And Ehud said , I have a message from God unto thee. And he arose out of \add his\add* seat.\f + \fr 3.20 \ft a summer…: Heb. a parlour of cooling\f*
And Ehud put forth his left hand , and took the dagger from his right thigh , and thrust it into his belly :

And the haft also went in after the blade ; and the fat closed upon the blade , so that he could not draw the dagger out of his belly ; and the dirt came out.\f + \fr 3.22 \ft the dirt…: or, it came out at the buttocks\f*
Then Ehud went forth through the porch , and shut the doors of the parlour upon him, and locked them.

When he was gone out , his servants came ; and when they saw that, behold, the doors of the parlour \add were\add* locked , they said , Surely he covereth his feet in his summer chamber.\f + \fr 3.24 \ft covereth…: or, doeth his easement\f*

And they tarried till they were ashamed : and, behold, he opened not the doors of the parlour ; therefore they took a key , and opened \add them:\add* and, behold, their lord \add was\add* fallen down dead on the earth.
And Ehud escaped while they tarried , and passed beyond the quarries , and escaped unto Seirath.
And it came to pass, when he was come , that he blew a trumpet in the mountain of Ephraim , and the children of Israel went down with him from the mount , and he before them.

And he said unto them, Follow after me: for the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* hath delivered your enemies the Moabites into your hand. And they went down after him, and took the fords of Jordan toward Moab , and suffered not a man to pass over.
And they slew of Moab at that time about ten thousand men , all lusty , and all men of valour ; and there escaped not a man.\f + \fr 3.29 \ft lusty: Heb. fat\f*
So Moab was subdued that day under the hand of Israel. And the land had rest fourscore years. \p
¶ And after him was Shamgar the son of Anath , which slew of the Philistines six hundred men with an ox goad : and he also delivered Israel.
